tool.name: Get genes by-region(s)-IDs
tool.description: Retrieve list of genes within specified region of rice genomes
tool.command:
#if str($reference.source) == "type": mkdir index_dir && ln -s $__tool_directory__/data/'$table' index_dir/tmp_table && tabix -p gff index_dir/tmp_table && tabix index_dir/tmp_table $reference.region |awk '$3=="$feat.typ"'|awk '{print $1,$4,$5,$7,$9}' OFS="\t" | sed 's/;Name=.\+//' | sed 's/ID=//' |sed 's/;Parent=.\+//' > '$outFile' && rm -rf index_dir
#else: mkdir index_dir && ln -s $__tool_directory__/data/'$table' index_dir/tmp_table && tabix -p gff index_dir/tmp_table && xargs tabix index_dir/tmp_table < '$rgnList' |awk '$3=="$feat.typ"'|awk '{print $1,$4,$5,$7,$9}' OFS="\t" | sed 's/;Name=.\+//' | sed 's/ID=//' |sed 's/;Parent=.\+//' > '$outFile2' && rm -rf index_dir #end if

param.name: table
param.help: The info is derived from gene annotation efforts independent of the genome assembly (from GFF or other info sources).
param.label: Reference genome to get genes..
param.option: Oryza sativa Nipponbare (tempJ) canonical genes RGAP7 annotation

param.name: typ
param.label: Gene or mRNA
param.help: Display gene or mRNA in the region?

param.name: source
param.label: Type in a region directly (chr:start-end), OR use regions list from history?
param.help: You can either type the region directly to search, or use multiple regions in a file from history.
param.option: Use a list of regions from the history

param.name: region
param.label: Search region
param.help: Directly type in your region (the chromosome/contig name SHOULD BE PRESENT in the genome) to list the genes (example in Nipponbare: Chr1:1-500000).

param.name: rgnList
param.label: Select genome region list
param.help: The chromosome/contig name SHOULD BE PRESENT in your target, and the region correctly formatted! See help section.

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**Get-genes- what it does**
Retrieves gene list in selected region from genome of choice::
Nipponbare (https://doi.org/10.1186/1939-8433-6-4) N22 v2 (https://doi.org/10.1038/s41588-018-0040-0) Azucena, IR64 (https://doi.org/10.1038/s41597-020-0438-2); gene annotations are NOT published yet!
... DO NOTE that chromosome prefixes are specific to a genome: For Nipponbare, it's Chr1, Chr2, .. Ch12. N22, Azucena , and IR64 have Chr01, Chr02, ... Chr12. Example for a directly typed region using Nipponbare : Chr1:1-500000 Example regions format for N22 (regions listed in a file. Format is chr:from-to, one per line, following Samtools faidx format ) Chr01:1-100000 Chr02:1-500000
**IMPORTANT:** The chromosome name in your region / region list should **MATCH** the chromosome name in the genome. USE **Get-contig-names** tool to extract the chromosome names of your target genome.
More genomes to come. Get-genes uses Tabix_ program and Samtools_ region format.
.. _Tabix: http://www.htslib.org/doc/tabix.html .. _Samtools: http://www.htslib.org/doc/samtools-faidx.html
